title: Supreme ATC Bot
description: I developed a script that scans the Supreme online store for new items based on specific keywords/images and automatically check out when the item is found. Using a combination of Python Requests, Selenium WebDriver, and PhantomJS, I was able to automate the process to purchase items quicker (~2 seconds to find the item and place the order).

title: MCMXC Clothing
description: As a web developer, I designed and built the website for a local clothing company and integrated it with the online clothing store. I was also responsible for photographing and editing several lines of clothing to be used in the website lookbook and catalog.

title: Yume Koi & Gardens
description: I built a new eCommerce website using Shopify and Craft CMS to sell koi and koi products with ease of use in mind for the client. Furthermore, I worked with the client to develop a separate "Koi For Sale" website using Craft CMS for content management and blogging

title: Sigma Eta Pi
description: Tasked with redesigning and deploying the organizationâ€™s new responsive website, my goal as Technology Chair was to optimize user experience and increase traffic with a professional, appealing design for the new website. Furthermore, I created marketing materials such as t-shirts, flyers, and banners using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator. Currently, I am Vice President of Operations, managing the organization's internal affairs.

title: Startup Fair LA
description: I worked with startups and other organizations on campus to put together a startup fair for LA-based startups to connect with UCLA students. As the Director of Marketing/Web, I was responsible for creating the brand and identity of the event, creating the website and designing promotional material such as flyers and t-shirts.

title: Arkaive
description: As a Front-end Developer Intern, I bridged the gap between design and engineering to build a responsive, user-friendly dashboard for school administrators and athletic departments. I was also responsible for designing mockups of new app features and promotional materials such as decks and flyers utilizing Sketch and Photoshop/Illustrator.

title: Where Should I Eat?
description: Built for the indecisive souls who spend hours trying to find the right place to eat. This is a minimal Flask application that generates random results based on specific preference and location inputs using the Yelp API. My goal for this project was to incorporate some new frameworks/libraries I've been meaning to test out (Flask, Bulma CSS).

title: Cal Fussman
description: I developed a brand new responsive website for New York Times bestselling author, keynote speaker, and consultant Cal Fussman. In doing so, I strived for professionalism and simplicity to promote Cal's brand. We just finished rebranding, working with another designer to draft mockups. The client sought a more positive and optimistic vibe, so we decided to use more blues in the website and eliminated corners.

title: LA Hacks
shortDescription: Largest hackathon on the west coast
description: Part of the design team for one of the nation's largest hackathons.

title: BoxCamp
description: Developed a brand new responsive website for the student-run storage company, implementing a fully functional payment system using the Braintree API and PayPal. Configured and maintained MySQL database servers
